title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: By 2025, selected government institutions at different levels have enhanced capacities to improve and budget inclusive, equitable and resilient social protection systems to address child poverty and social exclusion, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and their families benefit from improved and adequately funded social protection and inclusion systems and enhanced child rights monitoring

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, selected government institutions at different levels have enhanced capacities to improve and budget inclusive, equitableand resilient social protection systems to address child poverty and social exclusion

description.narrative: Child disability assessment reform championed by two pilot Cantons in FBiH achieved significant milestones. Based on these pre-conditions, Herzegovina-Neretva Canton revised Law on Social Protection and allocated budget for the implementation of the functional assessment in 2022 and Zenica Doboj Canton committed to the same approach later next year. Entity Guidelines for development of Shock-Responsive Social Protection/DRR Action Plans were developed and 10 APs developed and adopted. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022

title.narrative: Existence of evidence generated on social protection budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditures for children, Text

baseline.value: No budget allocated to child cash benefits from the level of the Federation of BiH

target.value: 2022: Evidence and advocacy contributed to improved budget allocation

actual.value: 2021:Investment Cases for children with focus on social protection, ECE and ECD health services initiated in 2021.

title.narrative: Risk-informed social protection systems strengthened to prepare for, adapt and respond to disasters in a timely and vulnerability-informed manner, Text

baseline.value: Risk-informed SP systems not in place

target.value: 2022:Local level SP actors improved DRR implementation and service delivery benefiting vulnerable children and families

actual.value: 2021:10 local CSWs adopted DRR Action plans and started their implementation. 5 new locations mobilized.
